name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor

reviews.text: The location was great and within walking distance of my meeting. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast is included and was a good variety. I would definitely stay here again when in Baltimore.
reviews.title: Good location and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big, clean, comfortable rooms with great beds. Lot of choices for breakfast in lovely large great room. Wonderful, responsive staff. Laundryfacilities. Close walk to Inner Harbor. Next door to Betsy Ross' home where Star Spangled Banner was sewn.
reviews.title: Convenient haven near Inner Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seems that I agree with all the positive comments and none of the negative from the other reviews. Would not hesitate to stay here again. Great rooms - good breakfast included.
reviews.title: Good Hotel - wonderful location

reviews.text: On April 1st I travelled to the Baltimore Inner Harbor with my husband and my 9 year old grandaughter. We stayed at the Fairfield Inn. It is located within walking distance of all the major attractions of the Inner Harbor. The hotel is new and the first green one in the area. The rooms are very nice and spacious and the staff is equally friendly and very accomodating. When we arrived we requested a mini fridge. Our room did not have one so they upgraded us to a 3 room suite. My granddaughter was thrilled to have an additional flat screen TV with living room area. It was simply lovely.
reviews.title: Baltimore Inner Harbor Fairfield Inn-March 2010 Trip

reviews.text: They also had a complimentary wonderful continental breakfast in a lovely atrium setting.
reviews.title: Awesome Location

reviews.text: Stayed here on business. Location of the hotel isn't the best & parking is tight. I valeted it for the night & the staff was very friendly. The hotel was very crowded. I had asked to be moved to a higher floor & unfortunately they couldn't accommodate. My room key didn't work initially & the staff moved me to another room a few doors down. Room wasn't bad, not much of a view & the maintenance man had to adjust the A/C.
reviews.title: Not bad for one night

reviews.text: The gym was decent with ok equipment and could be upgraded.
reviews.title: Abysmal failure if customer service.

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful. I would return.
reviews.title: Fairfield Inn - Baltimore Inner Harbor

reviews.text: We stayed here for my nephew's wedding. We arrived shortly after the 3PM check-in time only to be greeted by à long line at the desk. After a half hour wait spent witnessing several frustrated patrons we finally got to the head of the line. We were informed that none of the three rooms we reserved were ready despite the fact that we were now nearly 45 minutes past the check-in time. We were not alone as a number of other people that were there for the same wedding, including one of the attendants, found themselves in the same circumstances as did people in another wedding party. As a result my wife was forced to change in a restroom while I had to impose on some relatives to dress in their room. We were not able to access our room till after the reception and so we found ourselves retrieving our luggage from our relative's room at around midnight. Particularly troubling was the insistence - the rather rude insistence - by a staff member wearing a name tag "Theresa" that this was not their fault.
reviews.title: Nice Surprise, My Return is for Sure

reviews.text: If this were not bad enough my wife and I headed to the lobby the following morning at 8:30 for breakfast service that commenced at 7AM. There was no coffee in the pots for caffeinated coffee and the decaf was ice-cold.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while attending meetings nearby. The hotel itself is very good - clean, comfortable, and everything in good repair. The employees are great. Everyone was welcoming and gracious, said hello when you came through the lobby or passed them in the halls. The location couldn't be better for visiting the Inner Harbor area - close to the waterfront and many restaurants, just a short walk over to Little Italy, and close to many attractions.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: I'd definitely stay at this hotel for future visits to the area.
reviews.title: Great Powerplant Live Location

reviews.text: Hotel was the perfect location since we were going to Powerplant Live for a concert and was able to walk one block back to hotel late at night. Up to consistent Marriott standards, no complaints at all. Inner Harbor is close as well. Valet parking was expensive but when I left I noticed you could park on the street behind the hotel if a space was avail and there was public park across the street. Go to Miss Shirley's Cafe for breakfast, 1 block away, you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Great stay! Walking distance to Inner Harbor.

reviews.text: Stayed here in August 2012 to visit the Inner Harbor. The hotel is really nice and I think it's fairly new. It is located with in walking distance to many of the great Baltimore attractions. I stayed in Room # 469, the room is very nice. It had a king bed and a separate living area. I forgot my iPhone charger at home and the room had a iPod docking station/radio so I was able to charge my iPhone that way. The hotel has 5 Floors. No Pool, but has a great breakfast in the morning. There is only Valet Parking which I don't remember if its free or if you pay for it. But that's nice and easy. If I ever visited the Inner Harbor I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Love the Location

reviews.text: Within walking distance to the Aquarium, Inner Harbor, Little Italy, shopping and restaurants. We usually stay at the Courtyard on Aliceanna St. but they were full so we thought we'd try the Fairfield Inn & Suites. Excellent service, although we did have to ask for shampoo and Kleenex (I think the maid simply forgot to restock the bathroom. Other than that we enjoyed our stay there. The rooms are very clean and a good size. Bathroom/vanity was also a good size. My only complaint is I wish they'd provide glass drinking glasses instead of those plastic cups. We had to pay the $30 for valet parking but it was worth it. They also have a special Johns Hopkins rate for outpatients/visitors.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: A friend and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites over the weekend while in town for a Ravens game. We arrived very early on Saturday morning (10 AM-ish) and was able to check-in. The hotel is located near the Inner Harbor, Little Italy and Fell's Point. It's a smaller hotel but is very quiet and all the staff we spoke too were very pleasant and accomodating. Our room was clean and spacious. We would stay again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Fairfield Inn on a stay in Baltimore. We checked in on a Sunday evening. Since we were taking a driving vacation, we had quite a bit of luggage. There is only valet parking and the valet was no where to be seen. After circling the hotel twice and waiting in the parking lot, we finally parked the car in the front and went in. The two people at the desk told us to go outside and wait. After about fifteen minutes, the valet showed up. We then had to struggle through the doors with all our luggage. The front desk people offered no help - not even to help us with the door. We had reserved a king room. When we got to our room we found we had two full size beds. My husband went back down and was told that his reservation had been changed. Since we did not change it, we were surprised that no one had let us know about the change. We were also supposed to have free parking but we were charged parking. We spent two nights at the hotel and the only pleasant employee we encountered was named Brittany - she removed the parking charges when we checked out. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance of the Inner Harbor.
reviews.title: Horrible service

reviews.text: Service was warm, free 24-7 coffee was hot, and this hotel was cool!
reviews.title: Centrally located, good-looking AND green!
5 "girls" from raleigh loved,loved,loved it!!!!!
reviews.text: Green is the theme inside, whether it be the leaf print in the well-lit bathroom, the mesmerizing trellis-patterned carpeting or the LEED-certified renovation of a brewery that is the hotel itself. Reclaimed wood, industrial fixtures & warm original brick archways lend earthy elegance.

Quick walk to harbor or Fells means this is a prime location in downtown B'more, steps from the intersection of President & Pratt. Easy auto access to Hampden & points north as well as in & out of town.
reviews.title: Goodness gracious!!!

reviews.text: The valet parking costs $30 which is way to high, although they were very fast. The AC was non-existent in the hallways and elevator. The AC took a while to get up to speed in our room as well and it didn't work in the bathroom. There is only one elevator to serve the majority of the hotels rooms on five floors so you will wait a lot. Our hotel room had a leaky fixture that dripped all night long and I was mad that I didn't bring my full travel bag that had earplugs as we were just there for one night.
reviews.title: Valet, AC, elevator and maintenance issues. OK for BOB late night after party.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar closes earlier than they say so if you are there with a group and you are planning on having an after party in the bar, it probably wont work. On the other hand, the hotel had no problem with guests bring coolers and hanging out in the extensive breakfast dining area which had comfortable seating and was air-conditioned.
reviews.title: The night of July 22, 2013 should have been free

reviews.text: The breakfast bar in the morning was very nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, great location, but you can do better for the money

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights, July 22 and 23, 2013. At 4:30 am, the fire alarm located above our bed woke us up. When it quieted down, 15 minutes later it went off again. This continued for hours. Needless to say, we didn't get much sleep that night. It appears that this totally SAFE hotel was being broken into and that set the WATER alarm off. We lost a day on the 23rd just trying to catch up on our lost sleep. We didn't have the maid service do any cleaning as we were trying to rest. We could not wait to check out of the hotel and did so very early on the 24th. In our opinion, the Marriott Rewards points used to pay for not sleeping should be returned to us. Sandra A. DiBella
reviews.title: Great property, great location in the Inner Harbor

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location and it is very nice. The value was ok, but I think for the money you can do better. The front desk staff was very nice along with one gentleman at the valet, but the rest of the staff we dealt with was not so friendly. We checked in and had to leave the room pretty quickly for an event. When we arrived back in the room we realized we had one bath towel so I called for more. I prepared a tip and waited for the towels. They arrived promptly and I thanked the gentlemen and I got an “mmmhmm” and he ran off. He was NOT friendly at all. The rest of the staff made no eye contact nor would they make eye contact whatsoever.
reviews.title: Clean rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my huband & i stayed there for our honeymoon" the weekend was great, the breafast was fresh, hot,& on time after a night of parting with family & friends. the staff was very pleasent & respectable. I willbe returning each year in" March" . Looking for that sweet hospitelity that we recieved this year , also it's a "GO GREEN HOTEL". Come see for yourself you will be please .
reviews.title: THE BEST REASONABLE & COMFORTABLE STAY EVERY

reviews.text: i went with my husband and mother in law july 4th weekend.. the staff was for the king bed suite so nice . we got there at 12pm and they let us check in three hours earlyl. great location. ten minute walk to the harbor five to little italy. i missed breakfast (slept late) the staff made up a plate for me despite my polite protests. valet service is pricey but vey hospitable- asked us if we needed any directions every time we got in the car. rooms clean. nothing fancy. we got the suite since mom in law with us. the only drawback was that i wish there was more of a seperation between the rooms. But will go again without her. cant beat the price. paid 150 on priceline fairfield 800 number wanted ten dollars more than priceline. overall a great place to stay for the money.
reviews.title: wont stay anywhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 2 nights here in late June 2010 and would stay again. The front lobby is upscale and inviting. Friendly, helpful staff made the check-in a breeze. Decor is more like a full-scale Marriott rather than their Fairfield line of hotels. Room was clean and fresh - no cleaning spray odors. We had a room on the second floor facing the street. A bit of street noise since the traffic light was right outside the hotel. (I'll ask for an "inside" room next time). Street traffic did quite down after 11 p.m.
reviews.title: Much more than a typical Fairfield Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: Park around the corner at the Dodge Garage and save a few $$. Walking was very close to the Harbor and allowed us to see the area. Take advantage of the happy hour at the bar and enjoy the food and special prices. Overall a great deal and would recommend it to friends.
reviews.title: Best for its location

reviews.text: I stayed here recently for a weekend with 5 friends. While we were impressed by its location (less than 10 minutes to the inner harbor, less than 5 to Little Italy), the staff was less than impressive. They were really irritated by simple questions like "What time is breakfast over?". Breakfast was poorly staffed and chaotic. There was a lot of eye rolling and grumbling by throughout the check in/check out process. Parking was VERY expensive - $28 per night, and there was a tiny parking lot, so I would imagine that it could get filled up pretty quickly during peak seasons. We just parked at one of the garages across the street which was "only" $18 per night. The location was so great, that I would stay there again (and recommend it to others), but don't expect anyone to go out of their way for you.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great as you're walking distance to shops, the Inner Harbor area, and right next to Little Italy. We never needed to use our car which was nice. The $30 for parking stinks but you're going to pay for parking wherever you go in the city so it's worth it in the long run. The rooms were nice. We had one suite that was beautiful and slept five. We had another room with a King bed and that was nice also but was pretty much a typical hotel room.
reviews.title: Great location but some things that could be upgraded

reviews.text: I don't know about other rooms but our shower had the WORST water pressure ever! Just horrible! The towels were also very thin and kind of worn.
reviews.title: great location, beautiful grounds but terrible treatment

reviews.text: Breakfast was really good with an excellent variety and a large seating area. The hotel staff was very professional but not overly friendly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is pretty well situated to all the attractions in the inner harbor - which was fab. However, I had the same issue as some of the other patrons - had to wait over 1h for my room (which was well after the 3pm check in) Hanging out in the lobby alone with 3 kids under the age of 4 - not so fun. At one point the man at the counter yelled at my kids for running around - and yes, they were playing and running in the lobby. I normally would never allow this but given the fact we were in the car for 5 hours and my room wasn't ready and we had to wait in the lobby for over an hour- who could blame them! I think they could do a little better when you have a lot of people checking in on time - not early - to accomodate them if their room isn't ready. It is their fault, not mine. So this really paved the way for my stay here. I would have given better review, but the poor customer service was turn off. The rooms were decent, breakfast was good also. However for the cost of the room I would have expected a little bit more courtesy.
reviews.title: nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the loud party next door to me all night didn't help things...
reviews.title: 3 stars for location and courtyard

reviews.text: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn with my nephews. The hotel was within walking distance of the Aquarium and the inner harbor. The rooms were comfortable and a good size. I found the staff to be very helpful. Having the complimentary breakfast was great with the kids, there was something for everyone and really helped to keep the cost down.
reviews.title: This hotel was conveniently located, had great service and accomodations.

reviews.text: Our family of four really enjoyed this hotel. The property was not much to look at from the outside, but inside it wasquite attractive. Brick walls in the lobby were a bit dark but whimsical furnishings, flooring and art made the atmosphere fun and unique. As an eco-hotel, there's an emphasis on recycling, "green" products, etc, though I can't say that it was really evident during breakfast.The courtyard was very comfortable to use with an interesting water feature. There is no pool, and there's a tavern attached to the lobby, so it's a bit more "grown up" perhaps than some Fairfield Inns, but the location is perfect for families visiting the Inner Harbor, National Aquarium, Little Italy, etc... Valet parking was about $28/day but we parked on the street one block behind the hotel in an area where the residents had no garages and parked on the street. It seemed fairly safe and the car was fine.
reviews.title: Unique for a chain hotel
Great Hotel...Parking rip off.
reviews.text: The desk staff was not super knowledgable but always tried to be helpful. I found it easier to use the internet to find direction, but the computers were conveniently only a few feet away from the front desk. There was also free wifi in the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At check in, I was informed that due to fire code, no rollaway was possible with the 2Q room, despite having reserved this hotel on the Marriott website months earlier and indicating a desire for a rollaway. Since I have teens of different genders, we really have to have a 3rd bed. The clerk worked with me to find a solution, first offering me a different type of room at a much higher price and then, when I expressed my disappointment in the additional costs, looked to find a handicapped room with 2 Qs and asked if we would be okay with it. Turns out this room was huge and had plenty of room for a rollaway. We were very comfortable. There was some noise in the hall which we could hear in the room and at one point, someone was running around up a floor from us and it was fairly loud, but we didn't hear the folks next door.
reviews.title: Friendly staff but not terribly clean.

reviews.text: The breakfast was definitely a step below the Residence Inns we'd been staying at. There was cereal, yogurt, instant oatmeal, some refrigerated prepared fruit, small (but tasty) muffins, the ubiquitous make-your-own waffle maker, and pre=packaged, refrigerated breakfast items (one was allegedly a pig in a blanket on a stick, but looked like a corn dog and the other was an awful "quiche"). Also toast, juice, bananas, etc.. But the coffee was the best we had on our trip and made up for alot with us! Disposable everything--plates, cups, glasses, etc,. However, the room was clean and had lots of different seating options; again we found it very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Location - Reasonable Price

aka: Fairfield Inn & Suites Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor Hotel
